intro: Lebeckia decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive lebeckia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disk, and it blooms during the cooler months. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
